work.name: Fraunhofer LBF
work.position: Student Intern in the Structural Durability Group
work.summary: I analyzed the interaction and coalescence behaviour of multiple cracks in welded joints using finite element analysis and experimental tests, and implemented the developed models within the IBESS computational algorithm.

work.name: Fraunhofer LBF
work.position: Contract Worker in the Structural Durability Group
work.summary: I studied the cyclic behaviour of additively manufactured specimens produced via the Selective Laser Melting (SLM) process and characterized anisotropic material behaviour through experimental and numerical tests.

work.name: Fraunhofer LBF
work.position: PhD Period Abroad in the Component-Related Material Behavior Group
work.summary: I transferred representative structure elements of additively manufactured components through different scales using analytical approaches and numerical methods.

work.name: Department of Civil and Industrial Engineering, University of Pisa
work.summary: I develop advanced computational methodologies for fatigue analysis—such as the Effective Critical Plane approach—and perform thermal-structural analyses, experimental tests, and residual stress evaluations on welded and additively manufactured structures.

work.name: Pierburg Pump Technology Italy S.p.A., Rheinmetall
work.summary: I collaborate on R&D projects to enhance the structural integrity and fatigue performance of polymer composites, elastomeric grommets, and PCB assemblies, contributing to more sustainable automotive products.

work.name: Department of Civil and Industrial Engineering, University of Pisa
work.summary: I assess the static and fatigue properties of metal, composite materials and joints under varying loading conditions and temperatures.
